ch.rabanti.picoxlsx4j.lowLevel

Class LowLevel

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.rabanti.picoxlsx4j.lowLevel.LowLevel

  • public class LowLevel
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for low level handling (XML, formatting, preparing of packing)
    This class is only for internal use. Use the high level API (e.g. class Workbook) to manipulate data and create Excel files.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor with defined workbook object

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Escaped string

      • escapeXMLChars

        public static java.lang.String escapeXMLChars(java.lang.String input)
        Method to escape XML characters between two XML tags
        Note: The XML specs allow characters up to the character value of 0x10FFFF. However, the Java char range is only up to 0xFFFF. PicoXLSX4j will neglect all values above this level in the sanitizing check. Illegal characters like 0x1 will be replaced with a white space (0x20)
        Parameters:
        input - Input string to process
        Returns:
        Escaped string

      • generatePasswordHash

        public static java.lang.String generatePasswordHash(java.lang.String password)
        Method to generate an Excel internal password hash to protect workbooks or worksheets
        This method is derived from the c++ implementation by Kohei Yoshida (http://kohei.us/2008/01/18/excel-sheet-protection-password-hash/)
        WARNING! Do not use this method to encrypt 'real' passwords or data outside from PicoXLSX4j. This is only a minor security feature. Use a proper cryptography method instead.
        Parameters:
        password - Password as plain text
        Returns:
        Encoded password
